010package imagingbook.common.edges;
011
012import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
013
014import java.util.ArrayList;
015import java.util.List;
016import java.util.Stack;
017
018import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
019import ij.process.ColorProcessor;
020import ij.process.FloatProcessor;
021import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
022import imagingbook.common.filter.linear.GaussianKernel1D;
023import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d.PntInt;
024import imagingbook.common.ij.IjUtils;
025import imagingbook.common.image.PixelPack;
026import imagingbook.common.util.parameters.DialogParameterBundle;
027
028/**
029 * <p>
030 * This class implements a Canny edge detector for grayscale and RGB images.
031 * See Sec. 16.3 (Alg. 16.3) of [1] for more detail.
032 * The edge detector is "lazy" in the sense that it performs local non-
033 * maximum suppression and edge tracing only when the results are explicitly 
034 * queried (by the methods {@link #getEdgeBinary()} and {@link #getEdgeTraces()}).
035 * </p>
036 * <p>
037 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing - An Algorithmic Approach</em>, 
038 * 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
039 * </p>
040 * 
041 * @author WB
042 * @version 2021/11/26
043 * @version 2022/03/22 added parameter annotations for dialogs
044 * @version 2022/09/04 converted to implement interface, use {@link PixelPack}
045 */
046public class CannyEdgeDetector implements EdgeDetector {
047        
048        // TODO: implement convolutions with GenericFilter
049        
050        public static class Parameters implements DialogParameterBundle {
051                
052                /** Gaussian sigma (scale, default = 2) */
053                @DialogLabel("Gaussian sigma (scale)")@DialogDigits(1)
054                public double gSigma = 2.0f;
055                
056                /** High threshold (defaults to 20% of maximum edge magnitude) */
057                @DialogLabel("High threshold (% of max. edge magnitude)")@DialogDigits(1)
058                public double hiThr  = 20.0f;
059                
060                /** Low threshold (defaults to 5% of maximum edge magnitude) */
061                @DialogLabel("Low threshold (% of max. edge magnitude)")@DialogDigits(1)
062                public double loThr = 5.0f;
063                
064                /** Set {@code true} to normalize gradient magnitude */
065                @DialogLabel("normalize gradient magnitude")
066                public boolean normGradMag = true;
067                
068                @Override
069                public boolean validate () { 
070                        return gSigma >= 0.1f && loThr < hiThr;
071                }
072        }
073        
074        private static final float CosPi8 = (float) Math.cos(Math.PI/8);
075        private static final float SinPi8 = (float) Math.sin(Math.PI/8);
076        
077        private final Parameters params;
078        private final int M, N;                                                 // width and height of I
079        
080        private FloatProcessor Emag = null;                             // gradient magnitude
081        private FloatProcessor Enms = null;                             // non-max suppressed gradient magnitude
082        private FloatProcessor Ex = null, Ey = null;    // edge normal vectors
083        private ByteProcessor  Ebin = null;                             // final (binary) edge map
084        private List<EdgeTrace> edgeTraces = null;              // list of edge traces
085        
086        
087        /**
088         * Constructor using default parameters.
089         * @param ip the image to be processed
090         */
091        public CannyEdgeDetector(ImageProcessor ip) {
092                this(ip, new Parameters());
093        }
094        
095        /**
096         * Constructor using specific parameters.
097         * @param ip the image to be processed
098         * @param params a {@link CannyEdgeDetector.Parameters} object
099         */
100        public CannyEdgeDetector(ImageProcessor ip, Parameters params) {
101                if (!params.validate()) throw new IllegalArgumentException();
102                this.params = params;
103                M = ip.getWidth();
104                N = ip.getHeight();
105                makeGradientsAndMagnitude(ip);
106        }
107
108        //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
109        
110        // do the inital work only
111        private void makeGradientsAndMagnitude(ImageProcessor I) {
112                if (I instanceof ColorProcessor) 
113                        makeGradientsAndMagnitudeColor((ColorProcessor) I);
114                else
115                        makeGradientsAndMagnitudeGray(I);
116                // this is done "on demand":
117                //nonMaxSuppression();
118                //detectAndTraceEdges();
119        }
120
121        private void makeGradientsAndMagnitudeGray(ImageProcessor ip) {         
122                FloatProcessor fp = ip.convertToFloatProcessor();       // always makes a copy
123                // pre-smooth the image with a separable Gaussian filter
124                float[] gaussKernel = GaussianKernel1D.makeGaussKernel1D(params.gSigma, true);
125                IjUtils.convolveX(fp, gaussKernel);
126                IjUtils.convolveY(fp, gaussKernel);
127                
128                // calculate the gradients in X- and Y-direction
129                Ex = fp;
130                Ey = (FloatProcessor) fp.duplicate();
131                
132                float[] gradKernel = {-0.5f, 0, 0.5f};
133                IjUtils.convolveX(Ex, gradKernel);
134                IjUtils.convolveY(Ey, gradKernel);
135                
136                Emag = new FloatProcessor(M, N);
137                float emax = 0;
138                for (int v = 0; v < N; v++) {
139                        for (int u = 0; u < M; u++) {
140                                double dx = Ex.getf(u,v);
141                                double dy = Ey.getf(u,v);
142                                float mag = (float) Math.hypot(dx, dy);
143                                if (mag > emax) 
144                                        emax = mag;
145                                Emag.setf(u, v, mag);
146                        }
147                }
148                
149                // normalize gradient magnitude (to max. value 100):
150                if (params.normGradMag && emax > 0.001f) {
151                        Emag.multiply(100.0/emax);
152                }
153        }
154        
155        private void makeGradientsAndMagnitudeColor(ColorProcessor cp) {
156                FloatProcessor[] I = new PixelPack(cp).getFloatProcessors();    
157                // pre-smooth the image with a separable Gaussian filter (on each RGB channel):
158                float[] gaussKernel = GaussianKernel1D.makeGaussKernel1D(params.gSigma, true);
159                for (int k = 0; k < I.length; k++) {
160                        IjUtils.convolveX(I[k], gaussKernel);
161                        IjUtils.convolveY(I[k], gaussKernel);
162                }
163                
164                // calculate the gradients in X- and Y-direction for each RGB channel:
165                FloatProcessor[] Ix = new FloatProcessor[3];
166                FloatProcessor[] Iy = new FloatProcessor[3];
167                float[] gradKernel = {-0.5f, 0, 0.5f};
168                for (int k = 0; k < I.length; k++) {
169                        Ix[k] = I[k];
170                        Iy[k] = (FloatProcessor) I[k].duplicate();
171                        IjUtils.convolveX(Ix[k], gradKernel);
172                        IjUtils.convolveY(Iy[k], gradKernel);
173                }
174
175                // calculate color gradient magnitude:
176                Ex = new FloatProcessor(M, N);
177                Ey = new FloatProcessor(M, N);
178                Emag = new FloatProcessor(M, N);
179                
180                float emax = 0;
181                for (int v = 0; v < N; v++) {
182                        for (int u = 0; u < M; u++) {
183                                double rx = Ix[0].getf(u,v), ry = Iy[0].getf(u,v);
184                                double gx = Ix[1].getf(u,v), gy = Iy[1].getf(u,v);
185                                double bx = Ix[2].getf(u,v), by = Iy[2].getf(u,v);
186                                double A = rx*rx + gx*gx + bx*bx;
187                                double B = ry*ry + gy*gy + by*by;
188                                double C = rx*ry + gx*gy + bx*by;
189                                
190//                              Eigensolver2x2 es = new Eigensolver2x2(A, C, C, B);
191//                              if (!es.isReal()) {
192//                                      throw new ArithmeticException(
193//                                                      String.format("No real eigenvalues for structure matrix at position (%d, %d)", u, v));
194//                              }
195//                              float mag = (float) Math.sqrt(es.getEigenvalue(0));
196//                              double[] eVec0 = es.getEigenvector(0);
197//                              Emag.setf(u, v, mag);
198//                              Ex.setf(u, v, (float) eVec0[0]);
199//                              Ey.setf(u, v, (float) eVec0[1]);
200                                
201                                double D = (float) Math.sqrt(sqr(A - B) + 4 * sqr(C));  
202                                double lambda0 = (A + B + D) / 2;                                               // eigenvalue lambda_0
203                                Emag.setf(u, v, (float) Math.sqrt(lambda0));
204                                Ex.setf(u, v, (float) (A - B + D));                                             // eigenvector x_0
205                                Ey.setf(u, v, (float) (2 * C));                                                 // eigenvector y_0
206                        }
207                }
208                // normalize gradient magnitude 
209                if (params.normGradMag && emax > 0.001) 
210                        Emag.multiply(100.0/emax);
211        }
212        
213        //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
214        
215        // perform non-maximum suppression along gradient direction
216        private void nonMaxSuppression() {
217                Enms = new FloatProcessor(M, N);
218                for (int v = 1; v < N - 1; v++) {
219                        for (int u = 1; u < M - 1; u++) {
220                                int s_theta = getOrientationSector(Ex.getf(u, v), Ey.getf(u, v));
221                                if (isLocalMaximum(Emag, u, v, s_theta, (float) params.loThr)) {
222                                        Enms.setf(u, v, Emag.getf(u, v)); // keep local maximum only
223                                }
224                        }
225                }
226        }
227        
228        private void detectAndTraceEdges() {
229                if (Enms == null) {
230                        nonMaxSuppression();
231                }
232                Ebin = new ByteProcessor(M, N);
233                int color = 255;
234                edgeTraces = new ArrayList<>();
235                for (int v = 0; v < N; v++) {
236                        for (int u = 0; u < M; u++) {
237                                if (Enms.getf(u, v) >= params.hiThr && Ebin.get(u, v) == 0) { // unmarked edge point
238                                        List<PntInt> pnts = traceAndThreshold(u, v, (float) params.loThr, color);
239                                        if (!pnts.isEmpty()) {
240                                                edgeTraces.add(new EdgeTrace(pnts));
241                                        }
242                                }
243                        }
244                }
245        }
246        
247        // Determines if the gradient magnitude is a local maximum at position (u,v)
248        // in direction s_theta.
249        private boolean isLocalMaximum(FloatProcessor gradMagnitude, int u, int v, int s_theta, float mMin) {
250                float mC = gradMagnitude.getf(u, v);
251                if (mC < mMin) {
252                        return false;
253                }
254                else {
255                        float mL = 0, mR = 0;
256                        switch (s_theta) {
257                        case 0 : 
258                                mL = gradMagnitude.getf(u-1, v);
259                                mR = gradMagnitude.getf(u+1, v);
260                                break;
261                        case 1 : 
262                                mL = gradMagnitude.getf(u-1, v-1);
263                                mR = gradMagnitude.getPixelValue(u+1, v+1);
264                                break;
265                        case 2 : 
266                                mL = gradMagnitude.getf(u, v-1);
267                                mR = gradMagnitude.getf(u, v+1);
268                                break;
269                        case 3 : 
270                                mL = gradMagnitude.getf(u-1, v+1);
271                                mR = gradMagnitude.getf(u+1, v-1);
272                                break;
273                        }
274                        return (mL <= mC && mC >= mR);
275                }
276        }
277        
278        /**
279         * Recursively collect and mark all pixels of an edge that are 8-connected to 
280         * (u0,v0) and have a gradient magnitude above loThr.
281         * @param u0 start coordinate (x)
282         * @param v0 start coordinate (y)
283         * @param loThr low threshold (min. edge magnitude to continue tracing)
284         * @param markVal value used for marking pixels on an edge trace
285         * @return a list of Point objects.
286         */
287        private List<PntInt> traceAndThreshold(int u0, int v0, float loThr, int markVal) {
288                //IJ.log("  working point " + u + " " + v);
289                Stack<PntInt> pointStack = new Stack<>();
290//              EdgeTrace trace = new EdgeTrace();
291                List<PntInt> trace = new ArrayList<>();
292                pointStack.push(PntInt.from(u0, v0));
293                while (!pointStack.isEmpty()) {
294                        PntInt p = pointStack.pop();
295                        int up = p.x;
296                        int vp = p.y;
297                        Ebin.putPixel(up, vp, markVal); // mark this edge point
298                        trace.add(p);
299                                
300                        int uL = Math.max(up - 1, 0);           // (up > 0) ? up-1 : 0;
301                        int uR = Math.min(up + 1, M - 1);       // (up < M-1) ? up+1 : M-1;
302                        int vT = Math.max(vp - 1, 0);           // (vp > 0) ? vp - 1 : 0;
303                        int vB = Math.min(vp + 1, N - 1);       // (vp < N-1) ? vp+1 : N-1;
304                        
305                        for (int u = uL; u <= uR; u++) {
306                                for (int v = vT; v <= vB; v++) {
307                                        if (Ebin.get(u, v) == 0 && Enms.getf(u, v) >= loThr) { 
308                                                pointStack.push(PntInt.from(u,v));
309                                        }
310                                }
311                        }
312                }
313                return trace;
314        }
315        
316        // returns the quantized orientation sector for vector (dx, dy)
317        private int getOrientationSector(float dx, float dy) {
318                // rotate the gradient vector by PI/8
319                float dxR = CosPi8 * dx - SinPi8 * dy;
320                float dyR = SinPi8 * dx + CosPi8 * dy;  
321                // mirror vector (dxR,dyR) to [0,PI]
322                if (dyR < 0) {
323                        dxR = -dxR;
324                        dyR = -dyR;
325                }
326                // determine the octant for (dx, dy)
327                int s_theta;
328                if (dxR >= 0) { // dxR >= 0, dyR >= 0
329                        if (dxR >= dyR)
330                                s_theta = 0; // return 0;
331                        else
332                                s_theta = 1; // return 1;
333                }
334                else {  // dxR < 0, dyR >= 0
335                        if (-dxR < dyR)
336                                s_theta = 2; // return 2;
337                        else
338                                s_theta = 3; //return 3;
339                }
340                return s_theta;
341        }
342        
343        @Override
344        public FloatProcessor getEdgeMagnitude() {
345                return Emag;
346        }
347
348        @Override
349        public FloatProcessor getEdgeOrientation() {
350                FloatProcessor E_theta = new FloatProcessor(M, N);
351                for (int u = 0; u < M; u++) {
352                        for (int v = 0; v < N; v++) {
353                                double ex = Ex.getf(u, v);
354                                double ey = Ey.getf(u, v);
355                                float theta = (float) Math.atan2(ey, ex);
356                                E_theta.setf(u, v, theta);
357                        }
358                }
359                return E_theta;
360        }
361        
362        /**
363         * Returns a binary edge image, obtained by rendering the
364         * detected edge traces.
365         * See also {@link #getEdgeTraces()}
366         * @return a binary image ({@link ByteProcessor})
367         */
368        public ByteProcessor getEdgeBinary() {
369                if (Ebin == null) {
370                        detectAndTraceEdges();
371                }
372                return Ebin;
373        }
374        
375        /**
376         * Returns a list of detected {@link EdgeTrace} instances.
377         * @return a list of {@link EdgeTrace} instances
378         */
379        public List<EdgeTrace> getEdgeTraces() {
380                if (edgeTraces == null) {
381                        detectAndTraceEdges();
382                }
383                return edgeTraces;
384        }
385
386}
